item.title: Indian Billionaire Gautam Adani Comes Under New Scrutiny from U.S. Prosecutors
item.description: The Justice Department is investigating whether Adani’s companies violated U.S. sanctions on Iran, after charging him in a bribery case last year.
item.dc:creator: Dave Michaels

item.title: Ukraine’s Stunning Assault Roils Russia’s Global Military Strategy
item.description: The drone strikes on Russian air force bases weaken Moscow’s ability to wage war on its neighbor and undermine its capacity to threaten more distant rivals.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Poland Elects Conservative With Ties to Trump as President
item.description: Karol Nawrocki, a historian who has flaunted his ties with the U.S. president, has promised to block a Ukrainian accession to NATO.
item.dc:creator: Karolina Jeznach

item.title: Mexico’s Judicial Election Puts Spotlight on Former President’s Son
item.description: Andrés Manuel López Beltrán, operations chief of the ruling Morena party that his father founded, oversaw the mobilization of millions of voters to participate in Sunday’s election.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: China Hits Back Against Trump Claims That It Broke Trade Truce
item.description: The Chinese Commerce Ministry said Washington had “seriously undermined” a consensus reached last month.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Qu

item.title: Opinion | Ukraine Still Isn’t Defeated
item.description: Daring drone raids on air bases deep inside Russia show Kyiv’s continuing will to fight.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: More Than 20 Gazans Killed Trying to Get Aid, Palestinian Authorities Say
item.description: The shooting is the deadliest incident since an Israeli-backed aid-distribution plan started last week.
item.dc:creator: Abeer Ayyoub

item.title: Ukraine Says It Destroyed Dozens of Warplanes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The clandestine drone attack deals the biggest blow of the war against Moscow’s long-range bomber fleet.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Opinion | Iran’s Latest Nuclear Weapons Progress
item.description: Two new IAEA reports document Tehran’s years of deception.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Mexico’s Judicial-Election Farce
item.description: The average voter in the capital was asked to choose 51 judges out of 293 candidates.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Mexico Has Never Voted for Judges, and Now It’s Electing 2,700
item.description: Mexicans voted in judicial races for federal and state judges, a new practice that opponents fear will give the ruling party control of the judiciary and empower candidates with criminal ties.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Seeking the Dalai Lama’s Blessing, a Tibetan Monk Sets Out to Flee China
item.description: Dreaming of glimpsing the Dalai Lama and facing oppression in Tibet, a monk embarked on a dangerous journey through Nepal to India to meet the Buddhist leader.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Paris Erupts in Celebrations, Riots After PSG Wins Champions League
item.description: Hundreds were detained after soccer fans’ jubilation gave way to violence in parts of the French capital.
item.dc:creator: Sam Schechner

item.title: Harvard Has Trained So Many Chinese Communist Officials, They Call It Their ‘Party School’
item.description: The university’s Kennedy School of Government has long been favored by party cadres seeking career boosts.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Needing Dollars, Iran-Backed Militias Turn to Visa and Mastercard
item.description: Armed groups lost access to dollars when a banking loophole was closed. They quickly pivoted to exploit a currency-exchange scheme using cards that at its peak involved $1.5 billion a month.
item.dc:creator: David S. Cloud

item.title: U.S. Envoy Says Hamas Response to Hostage Deal ‘Totally Unacceptable’
item.description: A Hamas official said the militant group wanted guarantees that talks would end the war with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Hegseth Warns of ‘Devastating Consequences’ Should China Seek to ‘Conquer’ Taiwan
item.description: The defense secretary said Asia is the administration’s priority region.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Iran Builds Up Near Weapons-Grade Uranium Stockpile Despite Nuclear Talks
item.description: The U.N. atomic agency reports that Iran hasn’t cooperated with a nuclear probe, raising the prospect of a snapback of sanctions on Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Canadian Pacific Kansas City Gets Ruling for New Collective Bargaining Pacts
item.description: Canadian Pacific Kansas City has received a ruling establishing new collective bargaining agreements with two units from the Teamsters Canada Rail Conference.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Cloonan

item.title: Her Husband Went Missing Fighting Russia. She Is Still Trying to Have His Baby.
item.description: The impact of the three-year-old conflict is reaching deeper into the most personal parts of Ukrainians’ lives.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Coles

item.title: China Manufacturing Activity Improves in May
A Lightning Fast Ascent of Everest Is Rocking the Mountaineering World
item.description: Four British climbers made it from London to the peak in under five days after preparations that included inhaling xenon gas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Soul-Sapping Grind of Doing Business in Bureaucratic Germany
item.description: Economists warn that red tape is smothering the country’s growth and discouraging investment.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Opinion | France, Yes Even France, Rethinks Low-Emissions Zones
item.description: A revolt across the political spectrum against driving limits.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Accuse Each Other of Delay Over Trump-Backed Talks
item.description: Washington reiterated its willingness to keep Kyiv’s bid to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization off the table, in line with Moscow’s demands.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Opinion | To Counter Beijing, Try a ‘Many Chinas’ Policy
item.description: The country is a mosaic, not a monolith. Even the Han majority is ethnically diverse and polyglot.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy B. Furchtgott

item.title: U.S.-China Trade Truce Risks Falling Apart Over Rare-Earth Exports
item.description: The U.S.-China trade truce in Geneva earlier this month hinged on Beijing agreeing to resume crucial mineral exports. Now China is slow-walking the concession, and the pact is in jeopardy.
item.dc:creator: Brian Schwartz

item.title: New U.S. Plan to Pause Gaza War Draws Hamas Criticism
item.description: The U.S. has presented Israel and Hamas with a new cease-fire proposal, though the militant group has already criticized it for not requiring an end to the conflict.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Macron Warns Europe and Asia Against Being Dragged Into U.S.-China Rivalry
item.description: France’s president called for a new partnership between European and Asian nations to protect the rules-based international order and avoid being ‘collateral victims’ of the two superpowers.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: A Shared Library Becomes an Unlikely Front in the ‘51st State’ Debate
item.description: The Haskell Free Library and Opera House straddles two countries and unites two towns. Plans to make it harder for Canadians to access the shared library are drawing pushback.
item.dc:creator: Joe Barrett

item.title: Israel Fears Being Boxed In by Trump’s Iran Talks
item.description: Israel is caught in a difficult position with its most important ally on its most pressing national security question.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Opinion | Netanyahu Is Trump’s Leverage With Iran
item.description: The threat of an Israeli attack is crucial to a nuclear deal worth making.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Case Against Soccer Star Maradona’s Medical Team Ends in Mistrial
item.description: A judge allegedly participated in a courtroom documentary about the case.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: The Risky ‘Side Launch’ That Doomed Kim Jong Un’s New Warship
item.description: The unconventional launch technique, a rushed timetable and a top-heavy warship contributed to the embarrassing capsizing.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Slam Eastern Europe’s Detroit
item.description: The U.S. president’s trade policies are exposing the fragility of an economic model built on car production and jeopardizing growth, jobs and standards of living.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Germany to Step Up Ukraine Aid as Europe Scrambles to Replace U.S.
item.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the two countries would also start a joint program to produce long-range weapons that Kyiv can use against Russian targets.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Putin Has Retooled Russia’s Economy to Focus Only on War
item.description: Moscow has expanded military recruitment and boosted weapons production. Peace could jeopardize the resulting economic gains.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Carney Says Canada and U.S. Are in Talks on a New Economic and Security Deal
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said the two nations “will cooperate where necessary, where it is in both of our interests very clearly, but we won’t necessarily cooperate.”
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: King Charles Defends Canada’s Sovereignty From Trump
item.description: The British monarch delivered a subtle message to President Trump in Canada’s Parliament: The country already has a king.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Says Putin Is ‘Playing With Fire’
item.description: The president has indicated he is weighing additional sanctions on Russia, potentially as soon as this week.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ Riles Nuclear-Armed Foes
item.description: China, Russia and North Korea claim the missile-defense project is driving a dangerous new arms race.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: The U.S. Reinforces Europe’s Northern Front, Fearing War With Russia
item.description: The U.S. military has doubled down in Northern Europe in a quest to make NATO more lethal.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: China Turns to Consumers to Boost Growth, but Households Are Wary
item.description: Beijing has offered incentives to prod shoppers to spend more, but leader Xi Jinping is reluctant to push a bigger shift away from manufacturing.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: U.S. Aims to Keep Chinese Navy Guessing With New Missile System
item.description: As China dominates swaths of the Pacific, the U.S. is looking for ways to push back. The Nmesis is a key part of that.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: North Korea Detains Officials Blamed for Kim Jong Un’s Capsized Warship
item.description: The three detainees are being held responsible for the botched launch of a 5,000-ton destroyer, an accident that has drawn the dictator’s wrath.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: The Fed Economist Accused of Espionage for Beijing
item.description: John Rogers voiced admiration for China before U.S. prosecutors accused him of sending secrets to Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Nick Timiraos

item.title: U.S. Considers Withdrawing Thousands of Troops From South Korea
item.description: The Trump administration is contemplating the redeployment of about 4,500 U.S. forces to Guam or other locations in the region.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: South African Leader Pushes Back on Trump’s ‘Genocide’ Claims in Tense Meeting
item.description: Cyril Ramaphosa is visiting the White House after relations with the U.S. deteriorated over race, Israel and trade.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Rebels in Captured City Force Residents to Clean Sewers and Morgues at Gunpoint
item.description: M23 insurgents backed by Rwanda are wielding their new authority harshly after taking over a city in eastern Congo.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Can a School Play Be a Threat to the State? Kenya’s Leaders Seem to Think So
item.description: President William Ruto and his former party chief have clashed over “Echoes of War” and its themes of a worsening generational divide.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: British Police Investigate Fires at Properties Linked to Prime Minister
item.description: British counterterrorism police are probing a string of suspected arson attacks on two properties linked to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Is Giving Refugee Status to White South Africans—but Many Don’t Want to Come
item.description: Relative wealth and generations of history dissuade many Afrikaners from claiming Trump’s offer; ‘This is my country.’
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.K. Plans to Tighten Rules After Record Influx of Migrants
item.description: Britain’s government said a record influx of foreigners since Brexit had done little to energize the economy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Who Joined Putin in Moscow to Celebrate Victory Day
item.description: More than 20 world leaders gathered in Red Square to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Key Player in Russian Oil Trading Hit by U.K. Sanctions
item.description: The U.K. sanctioned Etibar Eyyub, a vital figure in Russia’s oil trade, stepping up economic pressure on Moscow to strengthen Ukraine’s hand in peace negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: Men Found Guilty of Felling Famous Tree in ‘Moronic Mission’ That Gripped U.K.
item.description: The pair’s destruction of the beloved Sycamore Gap tree stoked nationwide anger and a criminal investigation.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: BOE Set For Modest Rate Cuts As Inflation Stays High, NIESR Says
item.description: Inflation is likely to remain stubbornly high this year, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research said as it cut is 2025 growth forecast for the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: ‘Trump With a Pint’: How Nigel Farage Is Upending British Politics
item.description: The populist politician’s Reform UK party is soaring in the polls—and doing better at the ballot box—as voters lose patience with slow economic growth and high immigration.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: India Has a Golden Opportunity to Capture U.S. Business From China
item.description: The world’s most populous nation has long trailed not just China but also smaller countries with nimbler governments.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Attacks on Darfur Relief Camps Threaten Bloody New Chapter in War
item.description: Fears are growing that a rebel militia is using violence to consolidate control in the famine-stricken region of Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Modi Positions India as Ally in Trump’s Illegal-Immigration Fight
item.description: India’s leader has supported the deportation of Indian citizens as New Delhi looks to safeguard U.S. relations and protect H-1B visas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: This Indian Festival Hosts More Pilgrims Than the Population of the U.S.
item.description: At least 400 million people are estimated to have attended the event, believed to be at least two millennia old and now drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
